Description:
1. Click the menu icon at the top left side to open navigation
2. Navigate to Administration and click Users tab
3. Verify all users are displayed with correct information (Name, Email, Role, Status, Last Login)
4. Navigate through pages using pagination controls
5. Verify pagination functionality works correctly
Test Data: Valid user data with various roles and statuses

Description:
1. Click different column headers to sort (Name, Email, Role, Status, Last Login)
2. Verify ascending sort order is applied on first click
3. Click same header again to verify descending sort order
4. Verify sort indicators (arrows) display correctly
5. Test sorting works for all sortable columns
Test Data: Sort by: Name Email Role Status Last Login

Description:
1. Click Add New User button in the action buttons section
2. Verify popup form opens with input fields for StaffID and Role
3. Enter StaffID 93313 in the StaffID field
4. Verify auto-filled name and email fields populate correctly
5. Select System Admin from role dropdown
6. Click Create button
7. Verify new user appears in first row of user list
8. Verify success confirmation message displays
Test Data: StaffID: 93313; Role: System Admin; Expected Name: John Smith; Expected Email: john.smith@clp.com.hk

Description:
1. Locate user John Smith in the user list
2. Click Edit button (pencil icon) on user row
3. Verify Edit and Delete buttons change to Save and Cancel buttons
4. Verify role field becomes editable while name and email remain read-only
5. Change role from User to Account Manager using dropdown
6. Click Save button
7. Verify changes are applied and reflected in user list
8. Verify confirmation message User [name] has been updated appears
Test Data: User: John Smith; Change role from User to Account Manager

Description:
1. Locate active user Mike Johnson in the user list
2. Verify current status shows Active with green status badge
3. Click toggle switch to disable user
4. Verify user status changes to Inactive with red status badge
5. Verify confirmation popup User [name] has been disabled appears
6. Verify user can no longer access platform (if login testing available)
7. Click toggle switch again to re-enable user
8. Verify status returns to Active
Test Data: Active user: Mike Johnson

Description:
1. Locate inactive user Sarah Wilson in the user list
2. Click Delete button (trash icon) on user row
3. Verify confirmation dialog opens asking to confirm or cancel deletion
4. Click Confirm button in dialog
5. Verify user is permanently removed from user list
6. Verify confirmation message User has been deleted successfully appears
7. Verify deleted user no longer appears in any filtered views
Test Data: User: Sarah Wilson (Inactive user)

Description:
1. Click to open the role filter dropdown button
2. Verify dropdown opens with all available roles listed
3. Click anywhere outside dropdown to close it
4. Open the filter dropdown again and click dropdown button to close it
5. Open dropdown and select System Admin checkbox
6. Verify only users John Smith and Jane Doe with System Admin role are displayed
7. Additionally select CIC Team checkbox  
8. Verify users with both System Admin AND CIC Team roles are displayed
9. Clear all filters and verify all users return to view
Test Data: Filter roles: System Admin and CIC Team; Expected users: John Smith Jane Doe

Description:
1. Locate and click the status filter dropdown
2. Verify dropdown shows All Statuses, Active, and Inactive options
3. Select Active from the dropdown options
4. Verify only users with Active status (John Smith, Jane Doe, Mike Johnson) are displayed
5. Change filter to Inactive
6. Verify only inactive users (Sarah Wilson) are displayed
7. Select All Statuses to reset filter
8. Verify all users return to the list view
Test Data: Filter: Active status; Expected active users: John Smith Jane Doe Mike Johnson

Description:
1. Locate the search input box with placeholder Search for user by name
2. Enter partial name john in search box
3. Verify search results dynamically filter to show John Smith
4. Clear search and enter email john.smith@clp.com.hk
5. Verify search results show matching user by email
6. Enter non-existent name XYZ123
7. Verify No users found message appears
8. Clear search box and verify all users return to list
Test Data: Search terms: john john.smith@clp.com.hk XYZ123

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
2. Verify bulk upload modal opens with download template option
3. Click Download Sample CSV Template link
4. Verify CSV template downloads with required columns (StaffID, Role)
5. Create test CSV file with 5 valid user records
6. Click Upload CSV button and select the test file
7. Verify file upload progress indicator displays
8. Verify import summary modal shows successful import statistics
9. Verify new users appear in user list with correct information
Test Data: CSV file with 5 valid user records: StaffID 93318-93322; Roles: Various; File size: <10MB

Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Roles tab
2. Verify all predefined roles are displayed in card format (System Admin, CIC Team, Account Manager, Corporate Affairs, Management, PSBG Engineers, User)
3. For each role card verify the following information is displayed:
   - Role name as header
   - Number of active users assigned to role
   - Edit and Delete action buttons
   - Complete list of permissions with granted/denied status indicated by checkmarks/X marks
4. Verify role cards are properly arranged in grid layout
Test Data: Default roles: System Admin(5 users) CIC Team(5 users) Account Manager(5 users) Corporate Affairs(5 users) Management(5 users) PSBG Engineers(0 users) User(2 users)

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
2. Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
3. Enter role name Custom Test Role in the name field
4. Review available permissions list and select the following permissions:
   - Full Dashboard Access
   - Send Notifications  
   - Download Data
5. Verify selected permissions show as checked with green checkmarks
6. Click Save button to create the role
7. Verify success message Role [Custom Test Role] has been created successfully appears
8. Verify new role appears in roles grid with correct permissions and 0 users count
Test Data: Role name: Custom Test Role; Permissions: Full Dashboard Access Send Notifications Download Data

Description:
1. Locate Account Manager role card in the roles grid
2. Click Edit button (pencil icon) on the Account Manager role card
3. Verify role edit modal opens with current role name and permissions pre-selected
4. Add Template Management permission by checking the checkbox
5. Remove Outage Management permission by unchecking the checkbox
6. Verify permission changes are reflected visually in the modal
7. Click Save button to apply changes
8. Verify confirmation message Permissions for role [Account Manager] have been updated appears
9. Verify Account Manager role card shows updated permissions in the grid
Test Data: Role: Account Manager; Add: Template Management permission; Remove: Outage Management permission

Description:
1. Ensure Custom Test Role exists and has no assigned users (0 users count)
2. Locate Custom Test Role card in the roles grid
3. Click Delete button (trash icon) on the role card
4. Verify confirmation dialog opens with warning message about permanent deletion
5. Click Confirm button in the confirmation dialog
6. Verify role is immediately removed from the roles grid
7. Verify success message Role has been deleted successfully appears
8. Verify deleted role no longer appears in any role dropdowns throughout the application
Test Data: Role: Custom Test Role (with no assigned users); Prerequisite: Role must exist and have 0 assigned users

Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Settings tab
2. Locate and expand Auto-Update Interval settings group by clicking the header
3. Verify current auto-update interval value is displayed clearly
4. Click on the interval input field and change value to 30 minutes
5. Verify input accepts only positive integer values
6. Click Save button in the settings actions section
7. Verify confirmation message Auto-update interval has been updated successfully appears
8. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 30 minutes
9. Test that the updated interval is applied to future interim notifications
Test Data: Interval: 30 minutes; Current value to verify persistence; Invalid test values: -5 abc

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Delay Control section
2. Expand Delay Control (Stage 1) section by clicking the header
3. Verify current Delay Before External Send (Minutes) value is displayed
4. Update the delay value to 10 minutes in the input field
5. Verify field only accepts positive integer values
6. Click Save button to apply the delay setting
7. Verify confirmation message Delay Time has been updated successfully appears
8. Verify the updated delay value persists after page refresh
9. Test that external notifications are delayed by the configured time during extreme weather
Test Data: Delay: 10 minutes; Test during extreme weather mode to verify delay is applied

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate External Communication toggle
2. Verify current status (Enabled/Disabled) is displayed clearly
3. Click toggle switch to change from current state
4. Verify warning popup appears stating Existing active communication will be terminated immediately
5. Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
6. Verify toggle switch changes state and save confirmation appears
7. Verify success message External communication setting has been updated successfully
8. Test that all active external communication processes are terminated immediately
9. Verify external notification functionality respects the new setting
Test Data: Toggle from Enabled to Disabled; Verify active external processes are terminated

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Internal Communication toggle
2. Verify current status (Enabled/Disabled) is displayed clearly
3. Click toggle switch to change from current state
4. Verify warning popup appears stating Existing active communication will be terminated immediately
5. Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
6. Verify toggle switch changes state and save confirmation appears
7. Verify success message Internal communication setting has been updated successfully
8. Test that all active internal communication processes are terminated immediately
9. Verify internal notification functionality respects the new setting
Test Data: Toggle from Enabled to Disabled; Verify active internal processes are terminated

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Trigger Mode section
2. Expand Trigger Mode settings group by clicking the header
3. Verify current Auto Trigger and Manual Trigger toggle states are displayed
4. Click Auto Trigger toggle to enable (ON position)
5. Click Manual Trigger toggle to disable (OFF position)
6. Verify toggle states are visually updated with correct labels
7. Click Save button in the settings actions section
8. Verify confirmation message Trigger mode settings have been updated successfully appears
9. Verify settings persist after page refresh
10. Test that notification triggering behavior matches the configured modes
Test Data: Auto Trigger: ON; Manual Trigger: OFF; Test both toggle combinations

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Data Retention section
2. Expand Data Retention settings group by clicking the header
3. Verify current retention period values for Customer data and Outage data are displayed
4. Click on Customer data retention input field and change value to 365 days
5. Click on Outage data retention input field and change value to 180 days
6. Verify input fields only accept positive integer values
7. Click Save button in the settings actions section
8. Verify confirmation message Data retention periods have been updated successfully appears
9. Refresh page and verify both settings persist correctly
10. Verify retention policies are applied to future data management
Test Data: Customer data: 365 days; Outage data: 180 days; Invalid test values: -1 abc

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
2. Select Manual Input radio button option
3. Verify customer account input field and Load Preference button are displayed
4. Enter Customer Account B1012345 in the input field
5. Click Load Preference button to retrieve current customer preferences
6. Verify channel preferences (App Push, SMS, Email) are displayed with current opt-in/out status
7. Change desired channel toggles to opt-out position
8. Click Save button to update customer preferences
9. Verify confirmation message Customer preference updated successfully appears
10. Verify updated preferences persist and are applied to future notifications
Test Data: Customer Account: B1012345; Test channels: App Push SMS Email; Expected status changes

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
2. Select Bulk Upload radio button option
3. Verify file upload interface and instructions are displayed
4. Click Download Sample CSV Template link
5. Verify sample CSV downloads with required columns (Customer Account, App Push, SMS, Email)
6. Create test CSV file with 10 customer opt-out preference records
7. Click file upload area and select the test CSV file
8. Verify file upload progress indicator displays
9. Click Upload button to process the bulk update
10. Verify import summary modal shows successful update statistics and any errors
11. Verify bulk preference changes are applied to all customers in the CSV
Test Data: CSV with 10 customer records; File format: Customer Account App Push SMS Email; Test both opt-in and opt-out values

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Delay Control section
2. Expand Delay Control settings group by clicking the header
3. Locate Delay Before External Send under Extreme Weather section
4. Verify current extreme weather delay value is displayed
5. Click on the extreme weather delay input field
6. Change value to 15 minutes in the input field
7. Verify field only accepts positive integer values
8. Click Save button in the settings actions section
9. Verify confirmation message Extreme weather delay has been updated successfully appears
10. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 15 minutes
11. Test that extreme weather notifications are delayed by the configured time
Test Data: Extreme weather delay: 15 minutes; Invalid test values: -5 abc; Test during extreme weather conditions

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Trigger Mode section
2. Expand Trigger Mode settings group by clicking the header
3. Locate Extreme Weather Mode toggle switch
4. Verify current extreme weather mode status is displayed clearly
5. Click toggle switch to enable Extreme Weather Mode (ON position)
6. Verify warning popup appears stating system will continue to send all ongoing messages
7. Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed
8. Verify toggle switch changes to ON position with visual confirmation
9. Verify confirmation message appears for successful activation
10. Test that system uses extreme weather message templates when mode is enabled
11. Verify mode status persists after page refresh
Test Data: Extreme Weather Mode: ON; Test with ongoing message scenarios; Verify template switching

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Alert Message Triggering section
2. Expand Alert Message Triggering settings group by clicking the header
3. Verify current alert time between stage 1 & stage 3 is displayed in minutes
4. Click on the alert time input field
5. Change value to 45 minutes
6. Verify field only accepts positive integer values
7. Verify alert time calculation explanation is shown (time calculated when 1st internal notification is sent)
8. Click Save button in the settings actions section
9. Verify confirmation message Alert time has been updated successfully appears
10. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 45 minutes
11. Test that alert notifications are triggered after the configured time when stage 3 is delayed
Test Data: Alert time: 45 minutes; Test notification timing; Invalid values: -10 abc

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Update Control section
2. Expand Update Control settings group by clicking the header
3. Verify current maximum number of updates value is displayed
4. Click on the max updates input field
5. Change value to 5 updates
6. Verify field only accepts positive integer values
7. Verify explanation about blocking further auto-updates when limit is reached
8. Click Save button in the settings actions section
9. Verify confirmation message Maximum update limit has been updated successfully appears
10. Refresh page and verify setting persists at 5 updates
11. Test that updates are blocked when the configured limit is reached
Test Data: Max updates: 5; Test update blocking behavior; Invalid values: -1 abc

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Opt-out Exception Report section
2. Click to open the Opt-out Exception Report window
3. Verify report interface opens with date filter and customer search options
4. Verify default date filter is set to Today
5. Select Today from the date filter dropdown options
6. Enter customer account B1012345 in the customer search field
7. Verify report data refreshes to match the applied filters
8. Verify accumulated records of wrong opt-out replies are displayed
9. Review report data columns (Date, Customer Account, Reply Time, Reply Message)
10. Click X button to close the report window
11. Verify window closes and returns to settings page
Test Data: Date filter: Today; Customer account: B1012345; Test various date ranges: Yesterday Last 7 days Custom Date

Action: Enable daily opt-out exception report email
Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Roles tab
2. Locate role that should receive opt-out exception reports (e.g., System Admin)
3. Click Edit button on the selected role card
4. In the permissions list, locate Receive opt-out exception report permission
5. Check the checkbox to enable this permission for the role
6. Click Save button to update role permissions
7. Verify confirmation message appears for successful permission update
8. Navigate back to Settings tab and locate Exception Report Email settings
9. Verify email delivery is enabled for users with the configured permission
10. Test that daily opt-out exception report emails are sent to authorized users
11. Verify email contains accumulated opt-out exception records in Excel format
Test Data: Role: System Admin; Email: enabled; Permission: Receive opt-out exception report; Test email delivery

Description:
1. Click Add New User button in the action buttons section
2. Verify popup form opens with input fields for StaffID and Role
3. Enter invalid StaffID 99999 in the StaffID field
4. Verify system attempts to auto-fill name and email fields
5. Verify error message appears stating User not found or StaffID does not exist
6. Verify name and email fields remain empty or show error indicators
7. Verify Create button is disabled or shows validation error
8. Click Cancel to close the modal without creating user
9. Verify no new user is added to the user list
Test Data: Invalid StaffID: 99999; Expected error: User not found; Verify auto-fill failure

Description:
1. Click Add New User button in the action buttons section
2. Verify popup form opens with input fields for StaffID and Role
3. Enter existing StaffID 93313 (already exists in system)
4. Verify system auto-fills name and email fields correctly
5. Select any role from the role dropdown
6. Click Create button to attempt user creation
7. Verify error message appears stating User already exists or Duplicate StaffID
8. Verify system prevents duplicate user creation
9. Verify original user remains unchanged in the user list
10. Click Cancel to close the modal
Test Data: Existing StaffID: 93313; Expected error: User already exists; Verify duplicate prevention

Action: Delete user assigned to role in use
Description:
1. Locate user who is currently assigned to an active role and has system dependencies
2. Click Delete button (trash icon) on the user row
3. Verify confirmation dialog opens with warning about user deletion
4. Click Confirm button to attempt deletion
5. Verify system displays error message preventing deletion
6. Verify error message explains user has active role assignments or dependencies
7. Verify user remains in the user list unchanged
8. Verify system suggests removing role assignments first before deletion
9. Close any error dialogs and verify user status remains unchanged
Test Data: User with active role assignments; Expected error: Cannot delete user with active roles; Suggest remove assignments first

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
2. Verify bulk upload modal opens with file selection options
3. Create test CSV file missing required StaffID column (only Role column present)
4. Click Upload CSV button and select the invalid CSV file
5. Verify system attempts to process the file
6. Verify detailed error message appears listing missing required columns
7. Verify error message specifically mentions Missing required column: StaffID
8. Verify no users are imported due to format validation failure
9. Verify import summary shows 0 successful imports and format error details
10. Close error modal and verify user list remains unchanged
Test Data: CSV missing StaffID column; Expected error: Missing required column StaffID; Verify format validation

Description:
1. Click Add New User by Bulk Upload button
2. Verify bulk upload modal opens with file selection options
3. Create or select test CSV file larger than 10MB file size limit
4. Click Upload CSV button and select the oversized file
5. Verify system attempts to validate file before processing
6. Verify file size error message appears immediately
7. Verify error message states File size exceeds maximum limit of 10MB
8. Verify file upload is rejected and no processing occurs
9. Verify import process does not start due to size validation
10. Close error modal and verify no changes to user list
Test Data: CSV file size: 15MB; Expected error: File size exceeds 10MB limit; Verify size validation

Description:
1. Locate the search input box with placeholder Search for user by name
2. Enter non-existent user name NonExistentUser in the search box
3. Verify search executes automatically as user types
4. Verify user list becomes empty showing no matching results
5. Verify No users found message displays prominently in the table area
6. Verify message is clear and user-friendly
7. Clear the search box by deleting all text
8. Verify all users return to the list view
9. Verify search functionality works correctly for subsequent searches
Test Data: Search term: NonExistentUser; Expected result: No users found message; Verify graceful no-results handling

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
2. Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
3. Enter existing role name System Admin in the name field
4. Select any permissions from the available permissions list
5. Click Save button to attempt role creation
6. Verify error message appears preventing duplicate role creation
7. Verify error message states Role name already exists or similar validation message
8. Verify system prevents saving the duplicate role
9. Verify original System Admin role remains unchanged
10. Click Cancel to close the modal without creating duplicate role
Test Data: Duplicate role name: System Admin; Expected error: Role name already exists; Verify uniqueness validation

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button in the action buttons section
2. Verify role creation modal opens with empty form
3. Leave role name field completely blank (empty)
4. Select some permissions from the available permissions list
5. Click Save button to attempt role creation
6. Verify validation error message appears for empty role name
7. Verify error message states Role name is required or similar validation message
8. Verify Save button is disabled or validation prevents submission
9. Verify no role is created due to validation failure
10. Enter valid role name to verify form validation is working correctly
Test Data: Role name: empty/blank; Expected error: Role name is required; Verify required field validation

Description:
1. Locate System Admin role card which has assigned users (5 users count)
2. Click Delete button (trash icon) on the System Admin role card
3. Verify confirmation dialog opens for role deletion
4. Click Confirm button to attempt deletion
5. Verify system displays error message preventing deletion
6. Verify error message explains role cannot be deleted because users are assigned
7. Verify error suggests removing user assignments before deletion
8. Verify System Admin role remains unchanged in the roles grid
9. Verify role user count and permissions remain intact
10. Close error dialog and verify role status is unchanged
Test Data: Role: System Admin (has assigned users); Expected error: Cannot delete role with assigned users; Suggest remove assignments first

Description:
1. Locate System Admin role card (default system role)
2. Click Edit button (pencil icon) on the System Admin role card
3. Verify role edit modal opens or system prevents editing
4. If modal opens, attempt to modify critical permissions or role name
5. Verify system displays warning about modifying default system role
6. Verify error message prevents modification of critical system roles
7. Verify message explains some roles are protected from modification
8. If Save button is available, verify it's disabled for critical changes
9. Verify original role permissions and name remain unchanged
10. Close modal and verify System Admin role status is preserved
Test Data: Default role: System Admin; Expected error: Cannot modify system default roles; Verify protection of critical roles

Description:
1. Navigate to Administration section and click Settings tab
2. Locate and expand Auto-Update Interval settings group
3. Click on the interval input field to edit the value
4. Enter invalid value -5 (negative number) in the input field
5. Verify field validation prevents negative values
6. Clear field and enter non-integer value abc
7. Verify field validation prevents non-numeric input
8. Click Save button to attempt saving invalid values
9. Verify validation error message appears preventing save operation
10. Verify error message explains only positive integers are allowed
11. Reset to valid value to verify validation works correctly
Test Data: Invalid interval: -5 and abc; Expected error: Only positive integers allowed; Verify input validation

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Delay Control section
2. Expand Delay Control settings group by clicking the header
3. Click on the delay time input field for external notifications
4. Enter invalid negative value -10 in the delay input field
5. Verify field validation prevents negative values immediately
6. Attempt to click Save button with invalid value
7. Verify validation error message appears preventing save
8. Verify error message states delay time must be positive integer
9. Clear field and verify empty value handling
10. Enter valid positive value to verify validation recovery
11. Verify system prevents saving any invalid delay configurations
Test Data: Invalid delay: -10 minutes; Expected error: Delay time must be positive; Verify negative value validation

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Data Retention section
2. Expand Data Retention settings group by clicking the header
3. Click on Customer data retention input field
4. Enter value 10000 days (exceeding reasonable maximum limit)
5. Verify field validation or system limit checking
6. Click Save button to attempt saving excessive retention period
7. Verify system displays error message about maximum limit exceeded
8. Verify error message explains acceptable range for retention periods
9. Test similar validation for Outage data retention field
10. Verify both fields have appropriate upper limit validation
11. Reset to valid values within acceptable range
Test Data: Retention period: 10000 days; Expected error: Exceeds maximum limit; Verify range validation for both fields

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
2. Select Manual Input radio button option
3. Enter invalid customer account X9999999 in the input field
4. Click Load Preference button to attempt retrieving preferences
5. Verify system attempts to lookup customer account
6. Verify error message appears stating Customer not found or Account does not exist
7. Verify customer preferences section remains empty or shows error state
8. Verify error message is clear and helpful for user
9. Clear the invalid account and verify field resets properly
10. Test with another invalid format to verify consistent error handling
Test Data: Invalid customer account: X9999999; Expected error: Customer not found; Verify account lookup validation

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Customer Management section
2. Select Bulk Upload radio button option
3. Create test CSV file with wrong format (missing Customer Account column)
4. Add some invalid customer account numbers in the CSV
5. Click file upload area and select the invalid CSV file
6. Click Upload button to attempt processing the file
7. Verify system validates CSV format and data
8. Verify detailed error report appears listing specific issues
9. Verify error report shows missing columns and invalid customer accounts
10. Verify no preference changes are applied due to validation failures
11. Verify summary shows 0 successful updates and detailed error breakdown
Test Data: CSV with invalid customer accounts; Expected errors: Missing columns Invalid accounts; Verify comprehensive validation

Description:
1. Start some active notification processes in the background (if possible)
2. Navigate to Settings tab and locate External Communication toggle
3. Verify current status shows Enabled with active processes running
4. Click toggle switch to disable external communication
5. Verify warning popup appears stating Existing active communication will be terminated immediately
6. Verify warning clearly explains impact on ongoing notifications
7. Click Continue in the warning dialog to proceed with disabling
8. Verify all active external communication processes are terminated immediately
9. Verify any in-progress notifications are stopped or cancelled
10. Verify system logs the termination of active processes
11. Verify users receive appropriate notification about communication being disabled
Test Data: Active notification processes running; Expected warning: Active processes will be terminated; Verify immediate termination

Description:
1. Determine current system user capacity limit (if configurable)
2. Navigate to user management and verify current user count
3. Add users until approaching the maximum system capacity
4. Attempt to add one more user when at maximum limit
5. Click Add New User button at system capacity limit
6. Enter valid StaffID and role information
7. Click Create button to attempt adding user at limit
8. Verify system handles limit gracefully with appropriate message
9. Verify error message explains system capacity has been reached
10. Verify existing users remain functional and unchanged
11. Verify system suggests capacity increase or user cleanup options
Test Data: System at max user limit; Expected behavior: Graceful capacity limit handling; Suggest solutions

Description:
1. Open multiple browser tabs or sessions with administration access
2. Navigate to user management in all sessions
3. Simultaneously perform edit operations on different users
4. Rapidly click edit/save/delete buttons in quick succession
5. Attempt concurrent operations on the same user from different sessions
6. Verify system handles concurrent operations without conflicts
7. Verify data integrity is maintained during rapid operations
8. Verify appropriate locking or conflict resolution mechanisms
9. Verify error messages for conflicting operations are clear
10. Verify system remains stable under rapid user interaction load
11. Verify audit logs capture all operations correctly
Test Data: Multiple simultaneous operations; Expected: Conflict resolution; Verify data integrity and system stability

Description:
1. Navigate to user management section
2. Apply role filter by selecting System Admin from role dropdown
3. Verify filtered results show only System Admin users
4. Additionally apply status filter by selecting Active status
5. Verify combined filtering shows only Active System Admin users
6. Add name search criteria while filters are active
7. Verify search works within the already filtered results
8. Clear filters one by one and verify results update correctly
9. Apply multiple role selections simultaneously (System Admin + CIC Team)
10. Verify multiple criteria filtering works correctly across all filter types
11. Test edge combinations like Active status + multiple roles + partial name search
Test Data: Filter: System Admin AND Active AND name search; Expected: Proper filter combination; Verify filter interaction

Description:
1. Navigate to user management and verify full user list is displayed
2. Click Name column header to sort ascending
3. Verify ascending sort indicator (up arrow) appears and data is sorted correctly
4. Click Name column again to sort descending
5. Verify descending sort indicator (down arrow) appears
6. Click Email column header and verify sort changes to email field
7. Repeat sorting test for Role, Status, and Last Login columns
8. Test sorting with filtered results (apply filter then sort)
9. Verify sort persists when navigating between pages in pagination
10. Test sorting with large datasets to verify performance
11. Verify sort indicators are visually clear and correct for all sortable columns
Test Data: Sort by: Name Email Role Status Last Login; Expected: Proper sort indicators; Verify persistence and performance

Description:
1. Create test scenario with 150+ users in the system (or simulate)
2. Navigate to user management to view the large user dataset
3. Verify pagination controls appear at bottom of user table
4. Verify page numbers and navigation arrows are displayed
5. Click through multiple pages using page number buttons
6. Test First Page, Previous Page, Next Page, Last Page navigation
7. Verify user data loads correctly on each page without duplicates
8. Apply filters and verify pagination adjusts to filtered results
9. Test sorting across paginated results
10. Verify page size limits (10, 25, 50 users per page if configurable)
11. Test performance with large datasets during page navigation
Test Data: Dataset with 150+ users; Expected: Smooth pagination; Verify performance with large datasets

Description:
1. Navigate to role management and select any existing role for editing
2. Click Edit button on a role card to open role editing modal
3. Select a permission checkbox to grant permission
4. Save the role and verify permission is granted
5. Edit the same role again and attempt to select same permission
6. Verify system handles duplicate permission assignment gracefully
7. Verify no duplicate permissions appear in the role
8. Test bulk permission assignment and deselection
9. Verify permission list remains consistent and clean
10. Test permission inheritance scenarios if applicable
11. Verify role permissions display correctly after multiple edit operations
Test Data: Duplicate permission assignment; Expected: Graceful handling; Verify permission list integrity

Description:
1. Click Create New Role button to open role creation modal
2. Enter unique role name Maximum Permission Role
3. Review complete list of available permissions
4. Select all available permissions by checking every permission checkbox
5. Verify all permissions show as selected with proper visual indicators
6. Click Save button to create role with all permissions
7. Verify role is created successfully with all permissions granted
8. Review role card to confirm all permissions are displayed correctly
9. Test role functionality by assigning to test user (if possible)
10. Verify system performance with maximum permission role
11. Verify role displays properly in role selection dropdowns
Test Data: All available permissions selected; Expected: Successful creation; Verify performance with maximum permissions

Action: Edit role while users are active
Description:
1. Identify a role that has active users currently logged into the system
2. Navigate to role management and locate the role with active users
3. Click Edit button on the role card to open editing modal
4. Modify some permissions for the role (add or remove permissions)
5. Click Save to apply permission changes while users are active
6. Verify system handles the role modification gracefully
7. Verify active users are notified about permission changes (if applicable)
8. Test if permission changes take effect immediately for active users
9. Verify no active sessions are interrupted by role modifications
10. Verify audit logs capture role changes with active user context
11. Test edge cases like removing critical permissions from active users
Test Data: Active users with role being modified; Expected: Graceful handling; Verify immediate permission updates

Description:
1. Schedule or simulate system maintenance mode
2. Navigate to Settings tab during maintenance window
3. Attempt to modify various settings (intervals, delays, communication toggles)
4. Verify system behavior during maintenance mode
5. Verify appropriate messaging about maintenance mode if applicable
6. Test if settings changes are queued or blocked during maintenance
7. Verify data integrity of settings during maintenance operations
8. Test settings persistence after maintenance window ends
9. Verify no settings corruption occurs during maintenance
10. Verify proper error handling and user messaging during maintenance
11. Test rollback scenarios if settings changes fail during maintenance
Test Data: During maintenance mode; Expected: Appropriate handling; Verify data integrity during maintenance

Description:
1. Open administration settings in multiple browser tabs or user sessions
2. Navigate to different settings sections in each session
3. Simultaneously modify different settings from multiple sessions
4. Test concurrent changes to the same setting from different sessions
5. Click Save buttons simultaneously from multiple sessions
6. Verify system handles concurrent settings modifications properly
7. Verify last-saved-wins or conflict resolution mechanism
8. Verify no settings corruption occurs from simultaneous changes
9. Verify appropriate error messages for conflicting operations
10. Verify audit logs capture all concurrent settings changes correctly
11. Test system stability under concurrent administrative operations
Test Data: Two admins modifying settings concurrently; Expected: Conflict resolution; Verify data integrity

Action: Extreme weather mode during normal weather
Description:
1. Verify current weather conditions are normal (non-extreme)
2. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Extreme Weather Mode toggle
3. Enable Extreme Weather Mode despite normal weather conditions
4. Verify system allows activation regardless of actual weather
5. Test message template switching to extreme weather templates
6. Verify system behavior when using extreme weather mode inappropriately
7. Test notification sending with extreme weather templates during normal weather
8. Verify system doesn't automatically disable mode based on weather
9. Verify administrators can manually control weather mode independent of conditions
10. Test switching back to normal mode and verify template reversion
11. Verify weather mode settings persist correctly regardless of actual weather
Test Data: Normal weather conditions; Expected: Manual control allowed; Verify template switching works

Description:
1. Create test CSV file with 10000+ customer opt-out preference records
2. Ensure CSV file is properly formatted with required columns
3. Navigate to Settings tab and select Bulk Upload option
4. Upload the large CSV file (10000+ records)
5. Click Upload button to start processing large batch operation
6. Monitor system performance during large batch processing
7. Verify progress indicators work correctly for large datasets
8. Verify system remains responsive during bulk processing
9. Verify memory and CPU usage remain within acceptable limits
10. Verify batch processing completes successfully without timeouts
11. Verify import summary accurately reports results for large dataset
12. Test system stability after large batch operation completion
Test Data: CSV with 10000+ records; Expected: Successful processing; Verify performance and system stability

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate communication toggle switches
2. Rapidly click External Communication toggle multiple times in quick succession
3. Verify system handles rapid toggle operations without errors
4. Test rapid toggling of Internal Communication switch
5. Rapidly toggle between Extreme Weather Mode on/off states
6. Verify each toggle operation registers correctly despite rapid clicking
7. Verify system state consistency after rapid toggle operations
8. Test warning dialogs appear and function correctly during rapid toggling
9. Verify no race conditions or state corruption occurs
10. Verify final switch states match the last intentional toggle action
11. Test system recovery if rapid toggling causes temporary inconsistency
Test Data: Rapid toggle operations; Expected: State consistency; Verify no race conditions or corruption

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and locate Alert Message Triggering section
2. Test minimum allowed alert time value (1 minute)
3. Enter 1 in the alert time input field
4. Verify system accepts minimum value and saves successfully
5. Test maximum allowed alert time value (1440 minutes = 24 hours)
6. Enter 1440 in the alert time input field
7. Verify system accepts maximum value without error
8. Test values just outside acceptable range (0 minutes, 1441 minutes)
9. Verify appropriate validation messages for out-of-range values
10. Test boundary values around system limits
11. Verify alert functionality works correctly with edge timing values
12. Test performance impact of extreme timing values on alert system
Test Data: Alert time: 1 minute and 1440 minutes; Expected: Boundary value acceptance; Verify validation and functionality

Action: Database connection failure during user add
Description:
1. Set up scenario to simulate database connectivity issues (if possible in test environment)
2. Navigate to user management and click Add New User button
3. Enter valid StaffID and role information in the form
4. Simulate database connection failure during save operation
5. Click Create button to trigger database operation during failure
6. Verify system displays appropriate error message about database connectivity
7. Verify error message is user-friendly and doesn't expose technical details
8. Verify user creation operation is properly rolled back
9. Verify no partial user data is saved in inconsistent state
10. Verify system provides guidance on next steps or retry options
11. Verify audit logs capture the database failure event appropriately
Test Data: Database connectivity issues; Expected: Graceful error handling and rollback; User-friendly error messages

Description:
1. Navigate to user management and start editing a user
2. Click Edit button on any user row to enter edit mode
3. Make some changes to user role but don't save immediately
4. Wait for user session to timeout (or force session expiration)
5. Attempt to click Save button after session has expired
6. Verify system detects session timeout and handles appropriately
7. Verify user is redirected to login page or session renewal prompt
8. Verify unsaved changes are handled gracefully (lost with warning or preserved)
9. Verify clear messaging about session expiration to user
10. After re-authentication, verify user can resume edit operation
11. Verify session timeout doesn't corrupt any existing user data
Test Data: Session timeout scenario; Expected: Session detection; Graceful handling of unsaved changes

Description:
1. Set up two admin sessions accessing same user management interface
2. Navigate to user management in both sessions
3. Select the same user (e.g., test user) for deletion in both sessions
4. Click Delete button simultaneously from both sessions
5. Attempt to confirm deletion from both sessions at nearly the same time
6. Verify system handles concurrent deletion attempts properly
7. Verify only one deletion succeeds and the other gets appropriate error
8. Verify error message explains user was already deleted by another admin
9. Verify no system errors or corruption occurs from concurrent operations
10. Verify audit logs capture both deletion attempts with proper timestamps
11. Verify user lists refresh properly in both sessions after conflict resolution
Test Data: Concurrent deletion attempts; Expected: Conflict resolution; One succeeds one gets clear error message

Description:
1. Navigate to bulk upload functionality for user management
2. Create valid CSV file with proper format and user data
3. Simulate system error during CSV processing (memory error, processing failure)
4. Upload the CSV file and start processing
5. Force or simulate system error during file processing
6. Verify system handles processing errors gracefully
7. Verify appropriate error message appears explaining processing failure
8. Verify error details are logged for administrative review
9. Verify no partial user imports occur due to processing failure
10. Verify user is notified about failure and provided next steps
11. Verify system remains stable after processing error recovery
Test Data: System error during bulk upload; Expected: Error logging and user notification; No partial imports

Description:
1. Navigate to role management section in administration
2. Select existing role that has assigned permissions to modify
3. Click Edit button on the role to open permission modification interface
4. Modify several permission settings (add/remove specific permissions)
5. Click Save button to initiate permission update process
6. Simulate system failure during permission update (database error service failure)
7. Verify system detects permission update failure immediately
8. Verify error message appears explaining permission update could not be completed
9. Verify original role permissions remain unchanged after failure
10. Verify no partial permission updates are applied leaving role in inconsistent state
11. Verify system logs error details for administrative troubleshooting
12. Verify users assigned to this role maintain original access levels
Test Data: Permission update system failure; Expected: Error detection and rollback; Consistent permission state

Description:
1. Set up two administrative sessions with same role management access
2. Navigate to role management in both sessions
3. In first session select a role and initiate assignment to a user
4. In second session simultaneously attempt to delete the same role
5. Complete role assignment process in first session while deletion occurs
6. Verify system handles concurrent role operations properly
7. Verify transaction integrity is maintained during conflicting operations
8. Verify either assignment fails with role deleted error OR deletion fails with role in use error
9. Verify clear error messages explain the conflict to administrators
10. Verify no orphaned assignments or invalid role states exist
11. Verify audit logs capture both conflicting operations with timestamps
12. Verify system data consistency after conflict resolution
Test Data: Concurrent role operations; Expected: Transaction integrity; Clear conflict resolution messaging

Description:
1. Navigate to Settings tab and modify several configuration parameters
2. Change multiple settings including timeouts notification preferences and data retention
3. Click Save button to store configuration changes
4. Simulate network interruption or connection failure during save operation
5. Verify system detects network failure during configuration save
6. Verify appropriate error message appears about network connectivity issues
7. Verify system maintains original configuration values if save fails completely
8. Verify no partial configuration updates occur due to network failure
9. Verify error message provides guidance about checking network and retrying
10. Verify retry mechanism is available after network is restored
11. Verify configuration integrity is maintained throughout failure
12. Test successful save operation after network connectivity is restored
Test Data: Network interruption during save; Expected: Data integrity protection; Configuration consistency

Description:
1. Access system configuration through administration settings
2. Modify related configuration parameters that could create conflicts
3. Set conflicting values (e.g., retention period longer than backup cycle)
4. Attempt to save configuration with conflicting parameters
5. Force system into invalid state through edge case configuration combinations
6. Verify system validates configuration relationships before saving
7. Verify error detection identifies conflicting or invalid configuration combinations
8. Verify clear error messages explain which settings are conflicting
9. Verify system prevents saving invalid configuration states
10. Verify suggested resolution or valid value ranges are provided
11. Verify configuration correction guidance is available to administrators
12. Verify system remains in valid operational state throughout validation process
Test Data: Conflicting configuration values; Expected: Validation and conflict detection; Error correction guidance

Description:
1. Navigate to settings with external system integration (ADMS SharePoint connections)
2. Verify current integration status and connection settings
3. Modify settings that require external system validation or data
4. Simulate external system failure or unavailability (network disconnect API failure)
5. Attempt to save settings that depend on external system connectivity
6. Verify system detects external system failure during integration
7. Verify appropriate error message explains external system connectivity issues
8. Verify error message identifies which specific external system is unavailable
9. Verify settings save gracefully fails without corrupting local configuration
10. Verify system provides guidance about external system requirements
11. Verify fallback behavior for external system-dependent features
12. Test successful integration after external system recovery
Test Data: External system unavailable; Expected: Integration failure detection; Fallback procedures

Description:
1. Navigate to extreme weather mode settings in administration
2. Enable extreme weather mode functionality if available
3. Configure extreme weather notification and escalation settings
4. Simulate weather service API failure or unavailability
5. Trigger extreme weather mode activation during API failure
6. Verify system handles weather API failure gracefully
7. Verify error message explains weather service connectivity issues
8. Verify fallback procedures are activated when weather API is unavailable
9. Verify manual extreme weather mode activation remains functional
10. Verify notification systems continue operating with fallback data
11. Verify appropriate escalation occurs despite API failure
12. Test proper functionality after weather API service restoration
Test Data: Weather API connectivity failure; Expected: Fallback procedure activation; Manual override functionality

Description:
1. Configure alert notification settings for various system events
2. Set up multiple notification channels (email SMS dashboard alerts)
3. Trigger system events that should generate alerts (outage threshold breach)
4. Simulate alert notification system failure during triggered events
5. Verify system detects alert system malfunction during event processing
6. Verify alternative alert mechanisms are activated automatically
7. Verify error notification is sent through backup communication channels
8. Verify critical alerts find alternative delivery methods
9. Verify alert failure events are logged for system administrators
10. Verify manual alert override capabilities remain functional
11. Verify alert system failure doesn't prevent core system functionality
12. Test alert system recovery and normal operation restoration
Test Data: Alert system malfunction; Expected: Alternative alert activation; Backup communication channels

Description:
1. Navigate to customer opt-out management settings
2. Prepare bulk opt-out operation with multiple customer accounts
3. Initiate bulk customer opt-out processing
4. Simulate opt-out service failure or unavailability during bulk operation
5. Verify system detects opt-out service connectivity issues
6. Verify appropriate error message explains service unavailability
7. Verify error handling preserves customer data and preferences
8. Verify retry logic attempts to reconnect to opt-out service
9. Verify batch processing stops gracefully without data corruption
10. Verify failed opt-out requests are queued for retry when service recovers
11. Verify manual opt-out processing remains available as fallback
12. Test successful bulk opt-out processing after service restoration
Test Data: Opt-out service failure; Expected: Error handling and retry logic; Manual fallback availability

Description: System runs out of memory/CPU during peak operations > Verify graceful degradation
Test Data: Resource exhaustion scenario

Description: Attempt to access admin functions without proper permissions > Verify security controls
Test Data: Invalid permission access

Description: System fails to write to audit logs > Verify alternative logging and error notification
Test Data: Audit logging system failure
